description: The Los Angeles Dodgers star reached the 50-50 milestone in his 150th game. He was already the sixth player in MLB history and the fastest ever to reach 40 home runs and 40 stolen bases in a season.
title: Shohei Ohtani becomes the first MLB player to top 50 homers and 50 steals in a season

description: In China the government is raising the official retirement age to combat a rapidly shrinking workforce. We hear reaction from Chinese workers. And life in Mexico City presents many challenges for people there. But getting a driving license isn't one of them.
title: Retiring Later in China; Getting a Driver's License in Mexico

description: The 60-year-old woman, who has not been named, was near the Old Faithful Geyser at the Wyoming national park this week when she stepped through a thin crust over scalding water, park officials said.
title: A woman sustains leg burns after straying from Yellowstone trail

description: A group of Black female scientists and mathematicians known as NASA's “Hidden Figures” were honored Wednesday with Congressional Gold Medals, the highest award given to citizens by Congress.
title: NASA's 'Hidden Figures' awarded Congressional Gold Medals for pioneering space work

description: The Federal Aviation Administration is investigating an incident aboard a Delta flight in which a cabin pressurization issue with the Boeing 737 caused some passengers to bleed from the nose and ears.
title: FAA investigating cabin pressure problem that injured passengers aboard Boeing plane

description: The Uncommitted National Movement announces it will not endorse Vice President Harris but does not want supporters to vote for former President Donald Trump, and discourages third party votes.
title: Uncommitted movement doesn't endorse Harris, but asks supporters to vote against Trump

description: With genetic samples from the infamous Wuhan market, a new study makes the case that raccoon dogs are likely the animal that infected humans. Proponents of the lab leak theory are dubious.
title: New research points to raccoon dogs in Wuhan market as pandemic trigger. It's controversial

description: The Teamsters, a large and prominent union, is not endorsing a presidential candidate this cycle, breaking away from what other labor unions are doing. And, tips on how to avoid credit card debt.
title: Why Teamsters won't endorse a candidate for 2024. And, how to avoid credit card debt.

description: Progress in preventing infections was being made in the country with Europe's second-highest number of HIV cases. Then came the Russian invasion.
title: Ukraine keeps up the fight against HIV while fighting a war

description: A Haitian community leader in Springfield, Ohio tells Morning Edition that some newcomers are pondering leaving after a string of bomb threats made to the city after former President Trump elevated debunked claims about new migrants during presidential debate with VP Harris.
title: Bomb threats followed Trump's false claims about Springfield. Some Haitians may leave

description: The "Ultimate World Cruise" consumed social media, with many comparing it to a reality show. But what was it really like? Passengers spoke with NPR, nine months and 60-plus countries later.
title: A viral nine-month world cruise saw plenty of drama, but not the kind you'd expect

description: Trump can now start selling his majority stake in the Truth Social parent company, as a lockup on insider sales expires. But that could tank the price of the stock.
title: Truth Social reaches a tricky milestone. Will Donald Trump cash out his stake?

description: The Secret Service is again facing criticism following a second apparent attempt on former President Donald Trump's life.
title: 2 close calls have the Secret Service facing criticism and an uncertain future

description: With the presidential election between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump as close as it is, the small percentage of undecided voters could have a big impact on the outcome.
title: 10 undecided voters explain why they haven’t picked a side in this election

description: Washing your body seems like a no-brainer. But once you get into the details, things get complicated. Dermatologists offer surprising advice on how often to shower, when to toss your loofah and more.
title: COMIC: Can I just wash the stinky bits? And other honest questions about bathing

description: A new law in New Hampshire will require anyone registering to vote for the first time in the Granite State to provide documentation they are U.S. citizens, like a birth certificate or passport.
title: Concerns about noncitizen voting drive sweeping new restrictions in New Hampshire

description: The Government Accountability Office found that Black girls received nearly half of the most severe punishments, like expulsion, even though they represent only 15% of girls in public schools.
title: Exclusive: Watchdog finds Black girls face more frequent, severe discipline in school

description: Federal housing vouchers are the largest rental aid program, but many landlords reject them. Experiments will test whether cash helps more people sign a lease.
title: In a major shift, the U.S. government explores giving renters cash, not vouchers

description: It’s been almost a year since the Food and Drug Administration approved the first genetic treatments for sickle cell disease. So far, only a few patients have received the long-awaited treatments.
title: Sickle cell gene therapies roll out slowly

description: More than 100 wildfires stretched thousands of firefighters to the limit in northern Portugal on Wednesday, with seven deaths as fires spread out of control over the weekend.
title: Portugal declares a state of calamity as wildfires rage out of control

description:
When Sterlin Harjo was growing up, he didn't see many Native Americans in mainstream media. But Sterlin's TV show, Reservation Dogs, changed that, depicting the lives of four Native teenagers growing up in Oklahoma. Sterlin talks to Rachel about how he thinks fate has guided his life, why people should go to more funerals and how hunting feels like praying.

To listen sponsor-free, access bonus episodes and support the show, sign up for Wild Card+ at plus.npr.org/wildcard
title: Sterlin Harjo didn't see himself in the TV shows he watched – so he made one
